intro: Linanthus tularensis subsp. culbertsonii, commonly known as the Culbertson's flaxflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Loasaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in arid or semi-arid environments. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. This subspecies is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and shrublands.
